resources.string: This app uses a new feature of Android Oreo called push-notifications. As a result of which the song control panel of the notification bar pops up when any changes are made to the song playback. For eg. next song is played or the song is paused so that you can change the song, play/pause while working on other apps without the hassle of opening the Echo app again or pulling down the notification panel to do the same.
However some users might find it a bit irritating or a distraction. Hence they can always change that behavior by modifying the notification setting of the app by following the given steps :
Open the Settings app and go to Apps & Notifications (or equivalent settings if you are running a custom UI) and open Notifications. Click on Echo in the list
Tap on Importance (which would be set to urgent by default)
Select High from the list Now Restart the app for the changes to take place

I care for your privacy and this app doesn\'t access data from any directory other than the Music, Audio, Alarms and Ringtone folders that are meant to host audio files. In order to have a seamless experience make sure that all the song files are located in one of these folders.
As this is an offline music player, it only works with songs stored offline on your device in the Music or Audio Folder.
(i) Do you have audio files (.mp3,.wav,.wma) stored offline on your device?
(ii) Still not seeing any song file in the list?
In order to have a seamless experience, it is recommended that all your music files are in the Music or Audio folders of your device.

Some custom OS / OEM manufacturers use a different name for the folders storing music files In that case the app should still be able to find the song files for you. If in case, you still get a blank list of songs, you can manually create a "Music" folder without quotes in your internal storage\'s root directory and copy your music files there.

You can go to your file manager, navigate to internal storage, press the 3 vertical dots on the top right corner of the screen and select new folder. Name that folder as Music in the exact same style and copy your song files to that folder using either your file manager or by connecting to your device to a computer.
Alternatively you can use this link to get detailed info on how to modify android\'s internal files:
You don\'t have any Songs in the Music Folder at the moment.\nAdd songs to continue enjoying the music.
You don\'t have any Albums in the Music Folder at the moment.\nAdd songs or albums to continue enjoying the music.
Playback failed. Please try another song or restart the app.
